operations.summary: Returns a list of all Identity Mapper objects

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SCIM filter

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Specifies a property value by which to sort

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Specifies either ascending or descending alphabetical order

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to return

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Indicates the number of results per page

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to include in the response

parameters.name: excludeAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to exclude from the response

responseMessages.message: The requested operation succeeded
The requested operation succeeded and no further information has been provided, such as in the case of a DELETE operation.
The request contents are incorrectly formatted or the request was made for an invalid API version.
The requester cannot be authenticated
The requester does not have the required privileges or another constraint failed, such as attempting to delete an edit-only object.
The requested path does not refer to an existing object or object relation.

The requested operation could not be performed due to the current state of the configuration. For example, an attempt was made to create an object that already exists or an attempt was made to delete an object that is referred to by another object.
The request is such that the Accept header does not indicate that JSON is an acceptable format for a response.
The server encountered an unexpected error.

operations.summary: Add a new Identity Mapper to the config

parameters.description: Identity Mapper to add
parameters.name: add-identity-mapper-request
attributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to include in the response

parameters.name: excludeAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of attributes to exclude from the response

parameters.name: applyChangeTo
parameters.description: Specify whether to apply this configuration change to a single server or the whole server group. This does not apply to mirrored subtree objects

mapperName.description: Name of the new Identity Mapper

replacePattern.description: Specifies the replacement pattern that should be used for substrings in the ID string that match the provided regular expression pattern.

extensionClass.description: The fully-qualified name of the Java class providing the logic for the Third Party Identity Mapper.

matchAttribute.description: Specifies the attribute whose value should exactly match the ID string provided to this identity mapper.

description.description: A description for this Identity Mapper

scriptClass.description: The fully-qualified name of the Groovy class providing the logic for the Groovy Scripted Identity Mapper.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the Identity Mapper is enabled for use.

extensionArgument.description: The set of arguments used to customize the behavior for the Third Party Identity Mapper. Each configuration property should be given in the form 'name=value'.

allIncludedIdentityMapper.description: The set of identity mappers that must all match the target entry. Each identity mapper must uniquely match the same target entry. If any of the identity mappers match multiple entries, if any of them match zero entries, or if any of them match different entries, then the mapping will fail.

anyIncludedIdentityMapper.description: The set of identity mappers that will be used to identify the target entry. At least one identity mapper must uniquely match an entry. If multiple identity mappers match entries, then they must all uniquely match the same entry. If none of the identity mappers match any entries, if any of them match multiple entries, or if any of them match different entries, then the mapping will fail.

scriptArgument.description: The set of arguments used to customize the behavior for the Scripted Identity Mapper. Each configuration property should be given in the form 'name=value'.

matchFilter.description: An optional filter that mapped users must match.

matchPattern.description: Specifies the regular expression pattern that is used to identify portions of the ID string that will be replaced.

matchBaseDN.description: Specifies the set of base DNs below which to search for users.

replacePattern.description: Specifies the replacement pattern that should be used for substrings in the ID string that match the provided regular expression pattern.
